creditline: The Larey E. Lindberg and Larey Swanson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: two photos attached together on back with Scotch tape; view of rugged mountains in background and ruins of Macchu Picchu
marks:
Inscription and Stamp

on back of each photo, in
text: Machu Picchu was a favorite photographic site of Indigenismo artists such as Chambi. The Peruvian photographer was one of the first photographers of indigenous background to give his perspective to archeological and cultural sites. The surrounding landscape of Machu Picchu is as much a part of the architecture as the structures themselves, and Chambi captures this essence in a wide panorama.
title: Panoramic View of Machu Picchu, Peru
